name: Weapon Master(25), Fighter(10), Rogue(5) for Swordflight
author: Vecho

posts.author: Vecho
posts.content:
I am a heavy single player module player. After Swordflight Chapter III 's releasing, i am trying to continue my previous journey. My previous character in Swordflight is a RDD optimized for level 20. Since in Chapter III you can reach lv 23 and the author promised he would continue the series, i am planing to debug the character into a epic build with Lexicon.

I had considered several melee build, like Ft/Cot/Rog, Ft/WM/Cot and Ft/WM/Rog. And my decision was made in the below process:

1. I would like to continue to play as a melee fighter, since i had collected so many equipment from Chapter II.

2. I like the UMD of thief, which is very helpful in self buff and buffing your teams, and it will bring me into the thief quest in Swordflight too.

3. COT is good for better saves and Weapon Master is best for the offense. Since it is quite easy to get some immune buff from equipment or UMD, i don't think it is necessary to go for COT.

4. I know WM25/Ft12/Rog3 is the most optimized spread, but i really can't stand to have Rog's skills until level 21. What is the point of having your character coming into fruit until the every end of the game. Not to mention that there is the possibility that i will miss some thief class only quests because i don't have thief class before level 21.

5. It was very tempting to go with a weapon master build with DW and DC for maximum killing power, but it is too feat intensive and i don’t think 5 or 3 Rog classes will fit into the build well enough. Besides the fact that many creature especially the mini bosses and bosses are immune to DC really turn me off.    

So, the final spread is Weapon Master(25), Fighter(10), Rogue(5).

Since it is my first time to make a build for my own, i think it maybe a good idea to post it here and let the experts give me some suggestions.

Compared with the build of Max in the below thread, my build has 1 less feat of IKD and 40 pts less of hp, but comes with 1 more pts of damage and 70 pts more of skills, which help me to maximize out the concentration skill. And i think my build is more easy to play from lv 1 to lv 20 too.
What bothers me most is the lack of IKD. I don't know how big an issue this is. Should i drop 1 STR for IKD with the result of lowering my AB and damage by 1 pts, increasing my hp by 40pts and lost 40 pts of skill pts ?

And yes, the weapon can or should be changed into a scimitar.

http://nwnecbguild.forumer.com/topic/52 ... 9V0fFt97IV

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hi Vecho. The problem here is that you need so many feats to qualify for WM and even more to qualify for Dev Crit, leaving you no wriggle room. You could lose Blind Fight, take KD at 12 and IKD at 15, but I value BF too highly - I'm sure others may disagree. I'd be more tempted to live without IKD.

When you wonder about dropping 1 STR, are you talking about a Great Strength, and taking IKD in epic? I don't see how you could lose one otherwise.

Another possibility, but one I don't think will appeal, would be to get 2 more levels of Fighter in pre-epic - giving you an extra feat. The problem there is sacrificing either 2 WM levels or 2 Rogue. It's a big call for just the one feat, imho.

EDIT: Blimey, that's a lot of white space - don't know how that happened! Oh, and thanks, I didn't know whether Swordflight was Dev Crit enabled or not, so you've cleared that up!

Sorry, Hip - hope this is better.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
I'm trying to understand exactly what you are trying to do and not completely making the connection, so bear with me, please.

1. You want to redesign a toon that you played through SF 1 and 2.

Are there any variables that RogueKnight stored on the bic that may affect how your toon responds to certain events in the 3rd installment?
That may determine whether your plan will work or not.

Are you planning to change the starting ability spread, class, race, etc.?  If you do, it may overwrite those variables I mentioned above.

2. Since you are optimizing the build for Level 40, are you really sure you want to wait to reap the benefits until subsequent installments of SF are released? 

If you check the timetable, it took RogueKnight over 8 years to release content that got the toon to its current level which you state will be Level 23 when SF3 has been completed (SF1 was originally released on 2-28-2008, then SF2 on 4-9-2012).  He's designing his adventures essentially on his own so to maintain the high quality takes a lot of time (I'm sure he doesn't need to be reminded of that fact.). So if I do a quick estimate, that's roughly 3 toon levels per design year if the trend continues.  That means the approx 18 levels needed to reach Level 40 should arrive somewhere around 2022, if at all, depending on RL issues that can change those sorts of eventualities.  I'm just giving some facts that may change your original plan.

3. Even if you don't lose stored variables, why not just use a trainer/deleveler/releveler like Halls of Advanced Training to reset whatever you like?  The "untouchable" elements will be the starting abilities, feats, race, class, skill allocation and alignment. After level 1, you can change just about anything and in minutes.  I believe you might be able to change the bic directly using Leto but need to be careful not to create a corrupted toon in the process.  Leto should be able to even change all the starting level stats. Not sure about that but that's the rumor.

Dunno. If it were me, I'd just start a new toon.  Neither of the SF modules take that long and if it turns out your crafty manipulations accidentally overwrote some key variable, you won't find out until too late that it isn't working as you planned.  Just my own opinion on the matter.

As far as IKD is concerned, the more high-level mages and clerics and creatures with paralyzing or death special attacks, the more important is IKD.  And undead mages are even worse since your crits won't affect them.

So, in short, I understand your modification decisions.  I just don't know how practical the overall strategy is.

edit: Damn Stagmeister!  Why use a quote for a reply immediately after the lead?  That quote hurts my eyes and soul.  PLease, please delete it.  TYVM, mate!
edit2: Whew!  Much, much better.  We can digest that small oops.

posts.author: Vecho
posts.content:
To Stagmeister:

"Hi Vecho. The problem here is that you need so many feats to qualify for WM and even more to qualify for Dev Crit, leaving you no wriggle room. You could lose Blind Fight, take KD at 12 and IKD at 15, but I value BF too highly - I'm sure others may disagree. I'd be more tempted to live without IKD."
The same here. I value BF more than IKD.
IMO, since i am a WM with a AB of 51, the lack of IKD will no hinder my power as great as that would on other melee characters.

"When you wonder about dropping 1 STR, are you talking about a Great Strength, and taking IKD in epic? I don't see how you could lose one otherwise."
Yes, it is my thought.

"Another possibility, but one I don't think will appeal, would be to get 2 more levels of Fighter in pre-epic - giving you an extra feat. The problem there is sacrificing either 2 WM levels or 2 Rogue. It's a big call for just the one feat, imho."
I do think the same.
------------------------------------------------
To HipRedux:

1. I will use the pic from my SF 2 character and i will delevel him to level 1 then relevel him using Debug Mode, and use the Leto program to add and remove feats or even change his race if need.
But i never expect this process will disrupt any information stored in my bic files before posting. I think i will still give it a try. So far, i have a good experience with Debug Mode and Leto which is very handy and time saving.

2. I did optimize the build for level 40. As for the waiting, i really didn't give it much thought though. Myabe i should consider your suggestion of designing a lv 23 build, which will be a very interesting experience.
But i think i will keep this thread for what it is, that is, a discussion of the feasibility of a build of lv 40 for the purpose of playing SP modules and the comparison of it with a WM25/Ft12/Rog3 one.

3. Restarting with a new toon will lose some data from my previous journey. With Leto, i can edit the build of my original character safetly, which is my original impression.
"As far as IKD is concerned, the more high-level mages and clerics and creatures with paralyzing or death special attacks, the more important is IKD. And undead mages are even worse since your crits won't affect them."
Thank you for your input.

"So, in short, I understand your modification decisions. I just don't know how practical the overall strategy is."
Are you referring to the feasibility of the build or the way in which i will edit my previous bic file?
---------------------------------------------------
To both:
Sorry for my poor english and the double post. I try to delete the first one but it never work.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Vecho wrote:
------------------------------------------------
To HipRedux:

"So, in short, I understand your modification decisions. I just don't know how practical the overall strategy is."
Are you referring to the feasibility of the build or the way in which i will edit my previous bic file?
---------------------------------------------------
To both:
Sorry for my poor english and the double post. I try to delete the first one but it never work.

 
I've never used Leto. I've only read the discussions back on the old legacy Bioware forums when Leto was but a new, shiny toy.  I'm a scardy cat when it comes to messing with character files.  But if you are confident using the features of Leto, go to it.  I've read that the variables for earlier quests, journal entries and such show up in the Leto screen for either editting or just leaving "as is".  But you would know better what can be done.

Don't fret the dupe post.  I'll take care of that for you.

If you do decide to post a Level 40 build for analysis, make sure to evaluate all similar builds as part of your optimization process.   To become worth posting as a legitimate contribution, it MUST offer something significantly different than the related builds and that doesn't mean just a slightly different class combination or combat potential.  It should play differently than the other look-alikes.  If it is just a tweak or two, that is not enough.  All of us take existing builds and modify them slightly to better suit our own playstyle or new environment.  But we don't post them as our own concepts.  They are just variants on a design that had already been established by another designer.

So if I plug in your current class combo here is what I get for the list of similar builds which need to be examined (which I don't have the time to do myself since it is not my build):

Adaptable Weapon Master fighter 6 / rogue 9 / weapon master 25 (human) by M1ke47
Stalwart Warrior fighter 8 / rogue 7 / weapon master 25 (dwarf) by Cinnabar Din
Master of the Deathaxe v.2 fighter 8 / rogue 10 / weapon master 22 (dwarf) by Kail Pendragon
Shin Slasher fighter 8 / rogue 13 / weapon master 19 (halfling) by Mithdradates
The Enforcer fighter 10 / rogue 2 / weapon master 28 (human?) by Mithdradates
The Skilled Swordsman fighter 10 / rogue 5 / weapon master 25 (human) by NolDrek
Blade of the Reaper fighter 11 / rogue 4 / weapon master 25 (human) by Big Meph
TwinBlade fighter 12 / rogue 3 / weapon master 25 (human) by pocketbeetle
The Forest Outlaw Staff Master fighter 12 / rogue 3 / weapon master 25 (human) by EROMB
Fighter10/WM28/Rogue2 fighter 10 / weapon master 28 / rogue 2 (dwarf?) by ChristianJock007
Gnarlic the Brute fighter 10 / weapon master 28 / rogue 2 (half-orc) by Zhoreb
The Two-Fisted Weaponmaster fighter 10 / weapon master 28 / rogue 2 (human) by Kaliban99
Dwarven Decimator fighter 10 / weapon master 28 / rogue 2 (dwarf) by LordAshton
Revised Halfling Daggermaster fighter 11 / weapon master 28 / rogue 1 (halfling) by Zhoreb
Halfling Daggermaster fighter 12 / weapon master 25 / rogue 3 (halfling) by Zhoreb
Dwarven Avenger fighter 12 / weapon master 25 / rogue 3 (dwarf) by Veridious
Twinblade fighter 16 / weapon master 19 / rogue 5 (human) by SovranSpecific
The Ginsu Master fighter 18 / weapon master 19 / rogue 3 (human) by Yar Stardawg
The Swashbuckler fighter 18 / weapon master 19 / rogue 3 (human) by 4SakN
The Ravaging Conquerer rogue 5 / fighter 7 / weapon master 28 (human) by Lockindal
Skilled Melee Tank rogue 10 / fighter 8 / weapon master 22 (human) by Empyre65
Versatile Weaponmaster rogue 13 / fighter 8 / weapon master 19 (human) by Jennalee
Court Duellist rogue 17 / fighter 4 / weapon master 19 (human) by I...Samphus
A Taste of Their Own Medicine rogue 3 / weapon master 25 / fighter 12 (elf) by Ithacan

I used WM minimum 19 levels, fighter minimum 4 levels and rogue 1 minimum to get this list.  There will no doubt be a mix of STR, DEX, racial bias, dual-wield, stealth, DevCrit, UMD and other factors explored but you'll need to check them each yourself and begin the elimination process to find those close to what your own idea is.  Obviously, this a very common and popular build combo so it will difficult to devise a unique concept that has not already been well-considered by other builders.

The only one I found in our Level 40 subforum is a relatively recent one: Expert Mercenary by Earthcore. Check that one as well.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
If you were to sacrifice a Great Strength, you might as well make it two. That would allow you to not only take IKD, but also something else - maybe Epic Will for a boost of 4 to an otherwise low save. You'd still have an AB of 50, and you might be able to adjust the epic feats to take what's most important to you a bit earlier. Just a thought, I don't claim to be an expert.

Oh, and your English is damn fine!

If I remember correctly, my point was that because he'd be buffing before going into combat, rather than doing any combat casting, he needn't worry about spell failures from being Taunted. Sorry, I probably phrased that badly the first time. Alas, no, I don't recall any specific anti-Taunt spells (although anything that boosts CON will give a boost to Concentration, of course).

posts.author: Vecho
posts.content: I max out Concentration for the sake of not being taunted and losing a few pts of AC, IIRC.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Vecho wrote:
----------------------------------------
 don't claim it as my own cocepts. I just want to know if i made the right adjustment.

="The only one I found in our Level 40 subforum is a relatively recent one: Expert Mercenary by Earthcore. Check that one as well."

-Thanks for the link. The comments there are very helpful.

 Are you sure that there are some spells will protect you from Taunt? I never realize that.


 
My bad.  I interpreted your goal as eventually submitting a completed build designed specifically for playing the SwordFlight series.  NP.

Ummm... you DID download the ECB legacy archive, didn't you?  It's more-or-less an essential tool for players and aspiring toon builders.  The legacy archive contains somewhere in the neighborhood of 3000 complete builds whereas our modest gathering can only boast of around 200.  All that is needed is a browser that can process Javascript and you can run it locally without being connected to the Web.

There are no spells that directly counter the taunt skill.  However, any spell that reduces opposed abilities (i.e. in this case, CHA) will influence the effectiveness.  Also, a Bard 6+ 's curse song lessens a taunt's success and it's basic song will raise the concentration skill on the opposite side of the equation, effectively doubling the opposed success penalty.

posts.author: Dante2377
posts.content:
One option that I don't think has been mentioned is drop 1 Great STR and start with 16 strength instead of 17, take the 3 starting stat points and put 1 in DEX and 2 in wis. That will allow you to take IKD and gain +1 reflex +1 will without sacrificing a whole skill.

Or if you're really worried about taunt, you could drop 2 Great STR as mentioned above and take IKD and ESF: Concentration. Though it's probably a better defensive move to take Epic Fort or Reflexes rather than ESF concentration or Epic Will as mentioned above. Taking a Fort or Reflex save of 22 and making it 26 will probably save you more often than taking a 15 Will and making it 19. Additionally, it's generally easier to get mind immunity (pro from alignment, clarity potions, cowl of warding, etc) than protecting the other saves, though that's environment dependent.

Also, a Bard 6+ 's curse song lessens a taunt's success and it's basic song will raise the concentration skill on the opposite side of the equation, effectively doubling the opposed success penalty."

I don't think any buff will help when you reach epic level, since you will encounter very high level taunts. Without substantial skill pts invested in the Concentration skill, you won't be taunt proof in the long run.

--------------------------
To Dante2377:

="One option that I don't think has been mentioned is drop 1 Great STR and start with 16 strength instead of 17, take the 3 starting stat points and put 1 in DEX and 2 in wis. That will allow you to take IKD and gain +1 reflex +1 will without sacrificing a whole skill. "

Yes, it is a trade off. But the only meaningful part is the IKD and +1 Reflex, +1 will is just a tiny water drop in a desert.

="Or if you're really worried about taunt, you could drop 2 Great STR as mentioned above and take IKD and ESF: Concentration. Though it's probably a better defensive move to take Epic Fort or Reflexes rather than ESF concentration or Epic Will as mentioned above. Taking a Fort or Reflex save of 22 and making it 26 will probably save you more often than taking a 15 Will and making it 19. Additionally, it's generally easier to get mind immunity (pro from alignment, clarity potions, cowl of warding, etc) than protecting the other saves, though that's environment dependent."

I don't think ESF Concentration is necessary too. Actually i am fine with having 45 pts in Concentration, which i think should be more than enough for PVM.
What i wonder is if I put too much emphasis in taunt proof. I get the impression that ppl in this forum don't think anti-taunt is necessary for a melee character.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Vecho wrote:
I don't think ESF Concentration is necessary too. Actually i am fine with having 45 pts in Concentration, which i think should be more than enough for PVM.
What i wonder is if I put too much emphasis in taunt proof. I get the impression that ppl in this forum don't think anti-taunt is necessary for a melee character.


 
It merely depends on the environment(s) where you are used to playing.  There's no set bias. 

Some designers build taunters into their AI, while others ignore taunting altogether.  In some high-magic worlds, item properties can boost skills to the +50 cap so alloting them to your build is almost an afterthought under those conditions.  With opposed checks, both are rolling dice so it can get hard to figure what "safe" is without getting a sizable test sample from the combat log.  Also, NPC taunters can be manipulated during the cool-down pretty easily especially if HiPS is enabled.  PvP is another ball of wax entirely.

And you are dead wrong about bards.  A level 26 bard can swing a conc vs. taunt check by 30 pts with curse song.  So if your 45 rank number is indeed safe, the bard only needs to invest less than half your toon's points into Concentration to achieve the same level of success your toon will with 45.

posts.author: Vecho
posts.content:
="Some designers build taunters into their AI, while others ignore taunting altogether. In some high-magic worlds, item properties can boost skills to the +50 cap so alloting them to your build is almost an afterthought under those conditions. With opposed checks, both are rolling dice so it can get hard to figure what "safe" is without getting a sizable test sample from the combat log. Also, NPC taunters can be manipulated during the cool-down pretty easily especially if HiPS is enabled. PvP is another ball of wax entirely."

I had seen many taunt in SF II which gave me a very bad experience in one encounter.

="And you are dead wrong about bards. A level 26 bard can swing a conc vs. taunt check by 30 pts with curse song. So if your 45 rank number is indeed safe, the bard only needs to invest less than half your toon's points into Concentration to achieve the same level of success your toon will with 45."

Thanks for pointing that out.
